body: To clarify: by "being called synchronously" do you mean that `executionStarted` and `executionFinished` will be called on the same thread for any given `TestIdentifier`?

The same thread might not be necessary. But the execution of the test should not start before `executionStarted` has returned. Stronger guarantee would be that no two calls to `executionStarted` for the same test identifier will happen concurrently.

> Stronger guarantee would be that no two calls to `executionStarted` for the same test identifier will happen concurrently.

In what scenario would `executionStarted` be called for the same test identifier multiple times?

> In what scenario would `executionStarted` be called for the same test identifier multiple times?

When more than one listener has been registered.

So you basically want us to add the following sentence to the docs, right?

> Listeners are called sequentially in registration order.

Is there anything else you rely on that's undocumented and should be added?

Yes:

> Test case execution won't start before all executionStarted calles have returned.

repository.name: junit-framework
repository.description: âœ… The programmer-friendly testing framework for Java and the JVM

rename.from: Guarantee that calls to TestExecutionListener are executed synchronously
rename.to: Guarantee that calls to `TestExecutionListener` are executed synchronously
